title: Publications
text:
Selected Publications
Below are selected recent publications by Prof. Juszczak. For the full list, see the homepage or contact directly.

Antala M., Juszczak R., van der Tol Ch., Rastogi A. (2022). Impact of climate change-induced alterations in peatland vegetation phenology and composition on carbon balance. Science of The Total Environment, 827, 154294. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.scitotenv.2022.154294
Lembrechts, J. J., … Juszczak R., … Lenoir, J. (2022). Global maps of soil temperature. Global Change Biology. https://doi.org/10.1111/gcb.16060
Bandopadhyay S., Rastogi A., Cogliati S., Rascher U., Gabka M., Juszczak R. (2021). Can Vegetation Indices Serve as Proxies for Potential Sun-Induced Fluorescence (SIF)? Remote Sensing, 13, 2545. https://doi.org/10.3390/rs13132545
Harenda K., Samson M., Juszczak R., et al. (2021) Impact of atmospheric optical properties on net ecosystem productivity of peatland in Poland. Remote Sensing, 13, 2124. https://doi.org/10.3390/rs13112124
Górecki K., Rastogi A., … Juszczak R. (2021) Water table depth, experimental warming, and reduced precipitation impact on litter decomposition in a temperate Sphagnum-peatland. Science of the Total Environment, 771, 145452. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.scitotenv.2021.145452
Wang S., Zhang Y., … Juszczak R. (2020) Warmer spring alleviated the impacts of 2018 European summer heatwave and drought on vegetation photosynthesis. Agriculture and Forest Meteorology, 295, 108195. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.agrformet.2020.108195
Rastogi A., Antala M., … Juszczak R. (2020) Impact of warming and reduced precipitation on growth and chlorophyll concentration in peat mosses. Scientific Reports 10, 8592. https://doi.org/10.1038/s41598-020-65032-x
Flechard C.R., … Juszczak R., … Sutton M. (2020) Carbon/nitrogen interactions in European forests and semi-natural vegetation. Biogeosciences, 17(6), 1583-1620. https://doi.org/10.5194/bg-2019-333
Flechard, C.R., … Juszczak R., … Butterbach-Bahl K. (2020) Carbon/nitrogen interactions in European forests and semi-natural vegetation. Biogeosciences, 17(6), 1621-1654. https://doi.org/10.5194/bg-2019-335
Pinto, F., Celesti, M., … Juszczak, R. (2020) Dynamics of sun-induced chlorophyll fluorescence and reflectance to detect variations in photosynthetic efficiency. Plant Cell and Environment, 43(7), 1637-1654. https://doi.org/10.1111/pce.13754

title: Prof. Dr hab. inż. Radosław Juszczak
text:
ORCID | ResearchGate | Publons | Google Scholar | Scopus | Email
Poznań University of Life Sciences
Faculty of Environmental Engineering and Spatial Planning
Laboratory of Bioclimatology, Department of Ecology and Environmental Protection
Piątkowska 94, 60-649 Poznań, POLAND
Tel: +48 61 846 65 52

About
Full Professor, environmental scientist specializing in greenhouse gas exchange, carbon and GHG balances, ecosystem responses to climate change, and remote sensing of peatlands. Member of the Polish Academy of Sciences, Committee on Environmental Engineering.


Research Interests

Greenhouse gas (CO₂, CH₄, H₂O) exchange between terrestrial ecosystems and the atmosphere
Carbon and GHG balances of natural ecosystems
Ecosystem responses to climate change
Climate manipulation experiments (PI of 2 peatland experiments)
Remote sensing of peatlands and Sun Induced Fluorescence
Agrometeorology, agrophysics
Weather and climate extremes



Memberships & Service

Member, Polish Academy of Sciences; Division IV Technical Sciences; Committee on Environmental Engineering
Member of COST Actions: SENSECO (CA17134), OPTIMISE (ES1903), Climmani (ES1308), EUROSPEC (ES0903)
Reviewer for numerous international journals and funding agencies

title: WETMAN
text:
Project duration: 2013-2017
Role: Project Participant

title: WETMAN
text:
Project Overview
The WETMAN project focused on Central European Wetland Ecosystem Feedbacks to Changing Climate through field-scale manipulation experiments. This international research initiative investigated how wetland ecosystems respond to climate change factors.

title: WETMAN
text:
Research Objectives

Assess wetland ecosystem responses to changing climate conditions
Conduct field-scale manipulation experiments to simulate climate change scenarios
Monitor ecosystem feedbacks and carbon cycling in wetland environments
Develop models to predict future changes in wetland function under climate change

title: WETMAN
text:
Significance
Wetlands are critical ecosystems for carbon storage, water regulation, and biodiversity. This project provided valuable insights into how these ecosystems might respond to future climate conditions, informing conservation and management strategies for these important natural resources.

title: Impact of heatwaves and droughts on peatland SIF and photosynthesis
text:
Project duration: 2021-2025
Funding: National Science Centre of Poland (NCN) 2020/39/O/ST10/00775 PRELUDIUM BIS
Role: Principal Investigator

title: Impact of heatwaves and droughts on peatland SIF and photosynthesis
text:
Project Overview
This project investigates the impact of heatwaves, droughts, water table fluctuations, and nutrient availability on sun-induced fluorescence (SIF), photosynthesis, and biophysical parameters of peatland vegetation. The research aims to improve understanding of peatland ecosystem responses to climate extremes and nutrient gradients using advanced remote sensing and field measurements.

title: Impact of heatwaves and droughts on peatland SIF and photosynthesis
text:
Research Objectives

Quantify the effects of heatwaves and droughts on peatland vegetation SIF emissions
Analyze the relationship between SIF and photosynthesis under stress conditions
Evaluate the influence of water table fluctuations on vegetation spectral properties
Assess the impact of nutrient availability on peatland vegetation responses to climate extremes

title: Impact of heatwaves and droughts on peatland SIF and photosynthesis
text:
Methodology
The research employs a combination of field measurements, controlled experiments, and remote sensing techniques to monitor and analyze peatland vegetation responses. Sun-induced fluorescence measurements provide insights into photosynthetic activity, while spectral and biophysical parameters help characterize vegetation health and function under varying environmental conditions.

title: Impact of heatwaves and droughts on peatland SIF and photosynthesis
text:
Significance
This research contributes to our understanding of peatland ecosystem resilience to climate change and helps predict future carbon dynamics in these important carbon sink ecosystems. The findings will inform conservation strategies and improve models of peatland responses to climate extremes.

title: POLIMOS: Technical Assistance for a Polish Radar and Lidar Mobile Observation System
text:
Duration: 2018-2019
Funding: European Space Agency (ESA); RFP/3-14619/16/NL/FF/mg
Role: Contractor

title: POLIMOS: Technical Assistance for a Polish Radar and Lidar Mobile Observation System
text:
Project Overview
The POLIMOS project involved technical assistance for the development and deployment of a Polish radar and lidar mobile observation system. This advanced system supports atmospheric and environmental monitoring in Poland, contributing to improved data collection and analysis capabilities.

title: POLIMOS: Technical Assistance for a Polish Radar and Lidar Mobile Observation System
text:
Research Contributions

Provided technical expertise for the development of the mobile observation system
Supported the integration of radar and lidar technologies for comprehensive environmental monitoring
Contributed to field testing and validation of the system’s performance
Assisted in the development of protocols for data collection and analysis

title: POLIMOS: Technical Assistance for a Polish Radar and Lidar Mobile Observation System
text:
Significance
This project enhanced Poland’s capabilities for atmospheric and environmental monitoring through the development of an advanced mobile observation system. The integration of radar and lidar technologies provides comprehensive data for research, environmental management, and policy development.

title: Assessment of warming and drier conditions on peatland vegetation
text:
Project duration: 2021-2025
Funding: National Science Centre of Poland (NCN) No. 2020/37/B/ST10/0121
Role: Project contractor

title: Assessment of warming and drier conditions on peatland vegetation
text:
Project Overview
This project assesses the impact of warming and drier conditions on photosynthetic efficiency, productivity, spectral characteristics, and morphology of peatland vegetation under controlled in-situ climate manipulation experiments. The research provides insights into peatland resilience and carbon cycling under future climate scenarios.

title: Assessment of warming and drier conditions on peatland vegetation
text:
Research Objectives

Evaluate the effects of warming on peatland vegetation photosynthetic efficiency
Assess changes in productivity under drier conditions
Analyze spectral characteristics of vegetation under climate manipulation
Document morphological adaptations of peatland plants to changing conditions

title: Assessment of warming and drier conditions on peatland vegetation
text:
Significance
Peatlands are crucial carbon sinks that may be vulnerable to climate change. This research helps predict how these ecosystems will respond to future climate scenarios, informing conservation and management strategies for these valuable carbon reservoirs.

title: Blog
text:
Blog
Welcome to the academic blog! Here you will find updates, news, and insights related to research, teaching, and fieldwork. (No posts yet.)

title: FLEX-EU: Technical Assistance for the Deployment of an Advanced Hyperspectral Imaging Sensor
text:
Duration: 2014-2017
Funding: European Space Agency (ESA) Contract No. 4000107143/12/NL/FF/If
Role: Subcontractor (CO₂ fluxes)

title: FLEX-EU: Technical Assistance for the Deployment of an Advanced Hyperspectral Imaging Sensor
text:
Project Overview
The FLEX-EU project involved the deployment of an advanced hyperspectral imaging sensor for environmental monitoring and research. As a subcontractor, Prof. Juszczak was responsible for chamber measurements of CO₂ fluxes in various ecosystems.

title: FLEX-EU: Technical Assistance for the Deployment of an Advanced Hyperspectral Imaging Sensor
text:
Research Contributions

Conducted chamber measurements of CO₂ fluxes across different ecosystem types
Supported calibration and validation of hyperspectral imaging data
Contributed to the development of methodologies for integrating ground-based flux measurements with remote sensing data
Participated in field campaigns for data collection and sensor testing

title: FLEX-EU: Technical Assistance for the Deployment of an Advanced Hyperspectral Imaging Sensor
text:
Significance
This project contributed to the advancement of remote sensing technologies for monitoring ecosystem processes and carbon dynamics. The integration of ground-based flux measurements with hyperspectral imaging data improved our ability to assess ecosystem functioning and carbon cycling at different spatial scales.

title: SIF and Photosynthesis
text:
Project duration: 2016-2021
Role: Principal Investigator

title: SIF and Photosynthesis
text:
Project Overview
This project investigated the relationship between Sun Induced Fluorescence (SIF) and photosynthesis in peatland vegetation under controlled climate manipulation conditions. The research aimed to understand how climate change factors affect the photosynthetic processes in peatland ecosystems.

title: SIF and Photosynthesis
text:
Research Objectives

Measure and analyze Sun Induced Fluorescence in peatland vegetation
Correlate SIF measurements with photosynthetic activity
Evaluate the effects of climate manipulation on SIF signals
Develop improved methods for monitoring peatland ecosystem responses to climate change

title: SIF and Photosynthesis
text:
Significance
This research contributes to our understanding of how peatland ecosystems respond to climate change at the physiological level. By studying the relationship between SIF and photosynthesis, we can develop better remote sensing tools for monitoring ecosystem health and carbon sequestration in these important carbon sinks.

title: Impact of climate change-induced alterations in peatland vegetation phenology and composition on carbon balance
text: Research on peatland vegetation and carbon balance.

title: Can Vegetation Indices Serve as Proxies for Potential Sun-Induced Fluorescence (SIF)?
text: Remote sensing and SIF research.

title: Projects
text:
Below are current and past research projects led or contributed to by Prof. Juszczak.



ReVersal – Restoring peatlands of the nemoral zone under conditions of varying water supply and quality. (2022-2025)
SIF & Heatwaves – Impact of heatwaves, droughts, water table fluctuations, and nutrient availability on sun-induced fluorescence (SIF), photosynthesis, and biophysical parameters of peatland vegetation. (2021-2025)
Climate Manipulation – Assessment of the impact of warming and drier conditions on peatland vegetation under climate manipulation experiment. (2021-2025)





POLIMOS (2018-2019): Technical Assistance for a Polish Radar and Lidar Mobile Observation System. ESA.
WETMAN (2013-2017): Central European Wetland Ecosystem Feedbacks to Changing Climate. Polish-Norwegian Research Programme.
FLEX-EU (2014-2017): Advanced hyperspectral imaging sensor deployment. ESA.
SWAMP Harrier (2015): EUFAR-Meteo France; Spectrometry of a wetland and modelling of photosynthesis. Project PI.
COST Action EUROSPEC ES0903 (2010-2013): Assessment of biophysical and spectral indices in relation to GHG exchange. Project PI.
COST Action ABBA ES0804 (2010-2013): Assessment of turbulent and energy fluxes in Rzecin peatland. Contractor.
FP7-INGOS (2011-2015): Integrated non-CO2 Greenhouse gas Observation System. Contractor.
FP7-GHG Europe (2010-2013): Greenhouse gas management in European land use systems. Contractor.
FP6-ADAGIO-SSA (2007-2009): Adaptation of agriculture in European regions at environmental risk under climate change. Contractor.
FP6-NITROEUROPE-IP (2006-2011): The nitrogen cycle and its influence on the European greenhouse gas balance. Contractor.
FP6-GREENFLUX-TOK (2006-2010): Micrometeorological techniques for in situ measurements of greenhouse gases exchange. Contractor.
FP6-AGRIDEMA-SSA (2005-2007): Modeling tools and agricultural decision-making. Contractor.
Bilateral project with Cornell University (2000-2003): Environmental Management of Rural Landscape in Central Europe. Contractor.
FP6-CARBOEUROPE-IP (2004-2008): Assessment of the European Terrestrial Carbon Balance. Contractor.





Sun Induced fluorescence (SIF) and photosynthesis of peatland vegetation under climate manipulation. NCN OPUS_11 (2016-2021). Project PI.
Impact of increased temperature and reduced precipitation on methane emission from peatland. NCN PRELUDIUM_13 (2017-2022). Contractor.
GDLP (2011-2017): Estimation of net CO2 fluxes in forest ecosystems on agricultural land. Contractor.
GDLP (2008-2011): Estimation of net CO2 fluxes in forest ecosystems. Contractor.
MNiSW (2007-2009): Adaptation of agriculture in vulnerable European regions. Contractor.
MNiSW (2006-2011): The nitrogen cycle in the environment and its impact on GHG balance in Europe. Contractor.
MNiSW (2006-2010): Micrometeorological techniques for measuring GHG fluxes in situ. Contractor.
MNiSW (2004-2008): Assessment of terrestrial carbon balance in Europe. Contractor.
KBN (2001-2003): Evapotranspiration process dynamics in agricultural land use. Contractor.
KBN (2003-2006): Digital weather forecasts for agrometeorological protection. Contractor, main author of WISIA decision support system.
KBN (2003-2004): Inventory and valorisation of in-field water reservoirs. Contractor.
